Article Title: Disney, Fox, Warner Bros' Venu Sports streaming plan is Dead: "After careful consideration, we have ...," says the joint statement
Article Text:
What's behind the scrapping of Venu Sports

The Walt Disney Co., Fox Corp. , and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. have abandoned their plans to launch a joint sports streaming service, Venu Sports , just days after reaching a settlement in a lawsuit that challenged the venture's potential anti-competitive impact.The companies announced the discontinuation of Venu Sports in a joint statement, citing the "ever-changing marketplace" and a desire to "meet the evolving demands of sports fans by focusing on existing products and distribution channels." They also expressed gratitude to the Venu staff and pledged support during the transition.‚ÄúAfter careful consideration, we have collectively agreed to discontinue the Venu Sports joint venture and not launch the streaming service,‚Äù the companies said in a statement. ‚ÄúIn an ever-changing marketplace, we determined that it was best to meet the evolving demands of sports fans by focusing on existing products and distribution channels. We are proud of the work that has been done on Venu to date and grateful to the Venu staff, whom we will support through this transition period,‚Äù the statement added.The decision follows a legal challenge initiated by FuboTV Inc. , a sports-focused streaming service, which argued that Venu Sports would stifle competition and harm consumers. FuboTV contended that the joint venture would exclude them from carrying certain key sports channels, potentially forcing them out of business, and would ultimately lead to higher prices for consumers. The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) also signaled its intention to scrutinize the project for potential antitrust violations.The concept for Venu Sports emerged last year as the three media giants sought to combine their valuable sports content into a single streaming package, targeting viewers who desired access to live sports without traditional cable subscriptions. The proposed service immediately drew opposition, culminating in FuboTV's lawsuit.Despite this settlement, other industry players continued to express concerns. EchoStar Corp. and pay-TV provider DirecTV Inc. submitted a letter to Judge Garnett, arguing that Disney's agreement with FuboTV did not fully address the underlying anti-competitive issues posed by the Venu Sports concept.The abandonment of Venu Sports comes as live sports remains a highly lucrative sector of the television industry. With the ongoing trend of cord-cutting, media companies are actively reassessing how to package and distribute sports content to reach audiences.
Article Summary: Disney, Fox and Warner Bros. announced the discontinuation of Venu Sports in a joint statement. The decision follows a legal challenge initiated by FuboTV Inc. The U.S. Department of Justice also signaled its intention to scrutinize the project for potential antitrust violations.

Article Text: Meta used Library Genesis ( LibGen ), a notorious pirated book database, to train its artificial intelligence models, potentially strengthening the copyright infringement case brought against the company by several authors.Judge Vince Chhabria of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California ordered the unsealing of documents Wednesday, dismissing Meta's redaction attempts as "preposterous" and aimed at avoiding negative publicity rather than protecting business interests.Internal communications exposed in the documents show Meta employees expressing concerns about downloading from LibGen, with one engineer noting reservations about "torrenting from a corporate laptop." LibGen, established in Russia around 2008, has faced previous legal challenges, including a $30 million judgment against it in September 2024.Judge Chhabria warned Meta against future excessive redaction requests, stating that any unreasonably broad sealing requests would result in all materials being unsealed.

Article Title: Elon Musk‚Äôs X is making it easier for users to identify parody accounts
Article Text:
X plans to make these labels mandatory

Elon Musk-owned social media platform X has announced that it will begin labeling parody and satire accounts to clearly distinguish them from authentic profiles. This move aims to prevent users from mistaking posts from these accounts as genuine statements from the individuals or organisations being spoofed.‚ÄúWe‚Äôre rolling out profile labels for parody accounts to clearly distinguish these types of accounts and their content on our platform. We designed these labels to increase transparency and to ensure that users are not deceived into thinking such accounts belong to the entity being parodied. Parody labels will be applied to both posts and accounts on X to clearly demonstrate the source of the content you‚Äôre seeing. We‚Äôll share details soon on when the label will become mandatory for parody accounts,‚Äù the company said in a post on X.‚ÄúThese accounts, like all accounts on X, must still adhere to the X Rules - particularly our Authenticity policy,‚Äù X added, saying that users can report an account if they believe an account is inauthentic or impersonating an entity.The label will be visible on both the account's profile and individual posts. Currently, users can manually add the label in their account settings.‚ÄúParody, Fan, and Commentary (PCF) labels are selected by people on X to indicate that the account depicts another person, group, or organization in their profile to discuss, satirize, or share information about that entity. This label distinguishes these accounts to ensure they do not cause confusion for others or incorrectly imply any affiliation. These accounts must still adhere to our Authenticity policy. X does not control the selection of these labels, and users may change their PCF label at any time,‚Äù the update policy says.Users can add the PCF label to their accounts by navigating to Settings and Privacy > Your account > Account information, and then selecting Parody, commentary and fan account.X plans to make these labels mandatory for parody accounts in the future and will share details about the timeline soon, as per a report by TechCrunch.

Article Title: Mark Zuckerberg shuts down Meta fact-checking program, replaces it with Community Notes in the US
Article Text: In a significant policy shift, Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, has announced the end of its third-party fact-checking program in the United States. This new approach will allow users to call out potentially misleading posts and provide additional context, rather than relying on independent fact-checking organisations."We're going to get rid of fact-checkers and replace them with community notes similar to X, starting in the US," Zuckerberg said in a video. "We've reached a point where it's just too many mistakes and too much censorship. It's time to get back to our roots around free expression ," he said.Zuckerberg cited the need to prioritise free expression and reduce mistakes in content moderation as reasons for the change. He acknowledged that the recent US elections played a role in this decision, describing them as a "cultural tipping point" towards prioritising speech."The recent elections also feel like a cultural tipping point towards once again prioritising speech, so we‚Äôre going to get back to our roots and focus on reducing mistakes, simplifying our policies and restoring free expression on our platforms,‚Äù the Meta CEO said.The policy reversal also includes lifting some restrictions on discussions around sensitive topics such as immigration and gender identity. Meta will focus its automated systems on removing high-severity violations and illegal content, such as terrorism and illicit drugs, while reducing proactive scanning for hate speech and other rule-breaking content.
Article Summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, has announced the end of its third-party fact-checking program in the United States. Article Title: Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone-Idea want telecom department to take this 'international call' on Amazon, Netflix and others
Article Text:
Telcos vs Amazon, Netflix and others

Telecom operators are reportedly lobbying the Department of Telecommunications DoT ) to adopt the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India 's (TRAI) definition of international traffic, a change that could boost their SMS revenues by over Rs 400 crore annually.According to a report in Economic Times, the Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI), whose members include Reliance Jio Airtel and Vodafone-Idea , have sent a letter to the telecom secretary Neeraj Mittal. The letter has urged the DoT to incorporate Trai's recommendations into existing unified license agreements and upcoming authorizations. Trai recently defined international traffic as SMS messages that originate or terminate from devices, servers, or applications located outside India. COAI believes this definition will provide much-needed clarity to the industry.Experts predict that adopting this definition could generate over Rs 400 crore in additional annual SMS revenue for telcos by preventing the misclassification of international messages as domestic ones.This push follows years of dispute between telecom operators and multinational companies (MNCs), including e-commerce giants, regarding message classification. These MNCs include Amazon, Flipkart, Netflix and others.Telcos have alleged that some MNCs process international transactions from foreign servers but send SMS messages from domestic systems to avoid higher international SMS charges. While Trai has set domestic SMS rates between 0.2 and 0.5 paisa, international SMS rates are significantly higher, ranging from ‚Çπ2 to ‚Çπ5 depending on the origin country.Trai's recent recommendation clarifies that any incoming application-to-person (A2P) SMS message should be considered international if it requires the use or intervention of any device, system, or application located outside India. This move addresses the issue of various entities, including financial institutions, e-commerce firms, enterprises, cloud providers, and OTTs, using A2P messaging without revealing the SMS origin. Telcos argue that this clarity is crucial.
Article Summary: Telecom operators are reportedly lobbying the Department of Telecommunications DoT to adopt Trai's definition of international traffic. Trai recently defined international traffic as SMS messages that originate or terminate from devices, servers, or applications located outside India. Telcos argue that this clarity is crucial.

Article Title: Elon Musk says ‚Äòyes‚Äô to Google and Microsoft AI heads on this
Article Text:

Elon Musk has joined the chorus of AI experts declaring that we've hit ‚Äúpeak data.‚Äù In a recent livestream, the xAI founder stated that AI models have essentially consumed all of humanity's accumulated knowledge and there‚Äôs very little real-world data left to train AI models on."We've exhausted basically the cumulative sum of human knowledge...in AI training," Musk said, adding, ‚ÄúThat happened basically last year.‚ÄùDemis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind , recently cautioned that the rapid advancements in AI chatbots may be slowing down. He attributed this potential slowdown to a growing scarcity of high-quality data for training AI models. Hassabis said that tech companies have essentially ‚Äòexhausted‚Äô the readily available data on the internet, having already used it to train existing large language models.In fact, about a month ago, Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman talked about the use of synthetic data to train AI models because the available data is exhausted ‚Äì something that OpenAI's former chief scientist, Ilya Sutskever, warned about.Musk believes the solution lies in synthetic data ‚Äì data generated by AI itself. He envisions AI models creating their own training data and engaging in a ‚Äúprocess of self-learning.‚Äù‚ÄúThe only way to supplement [real-world data] is with synthetic data, where the AI creates [training data],‚Äù he said.‚ÄúWith synthetic data ‚Ä¶ [AI] will sort of grade itself and go through this process of self-learning,‚Äù he added.This approach is already being adopted by major players like Microsoft, Meta, OpenAI, and Anthropic, who are using synthetic data to train their most advanced AI models.Google DeepMind has reportedly been using synthetic data to train AL models and it relied on this method to help train a model that can solve Olympiad-level geometry problems.In fact, the AI arm of Google recently pointed to inference-time compute ‚Äì a solution to tackle the lack of data to train AI models. This technique allows AI models to tackle complex tasks by breaking them down into smaller, manageable prompts, essentially learning along the way."We‚Äôre generating vast amounts of synthetic data. That synthetic data is increasingly high quality," Suleyman told The Verge in an interview last month.

Article Title: Microsoft CEOs timeline: The legacies of Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer, and Satya Nadella
Article Text:
Bill Gates to Satya Nadella: CEOs behind Microsoft‚Äôs success

Bill Gates: The Founding Visionary (1975‚Äì2000)

Pioneering the PC revolution: Gates secured a pivotal deal in 1980 to supply the operating system for IBM‚Äôs first personal computer. Microsoft purchased and adapted an existing system, branding it MS-DOS. This move catapulted Microsoft into prominence as a leader in operating systems.

Innovations in software: The launch of Windows 1.0 in 1985 introduced the Graphical User Interface, making computing more accessible. Subsequent versions, such as Windows 3.0 (1990) and Windows 95 (1995), solidified Microsoft‚Äôs dominance. The introduction of Microsoft Office further cemented its role as the go-to provider of business productivity tools.

Growth and challenges: Microsoft‚Äôs 1986 Initial Public Offering (IPO) made Gates a billionaire at age 31. However, the company faced legal scrutiny in the late 1990s when the U.S. Department of Justice accused it of monopolistic practices by bundling Internet Explorer with Windows. Despite a protracted legal battle, Microsoft reached a settlement in 2001.

Legacy: Gates stepped down as CEO in 2000 to focus on philanthropy through the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. His tenure left an indelible mark on the technology landscape, making Microsoft synonymous with personal and professional computing.

Steve Ballmer: Expanding Horizons (2000‚Äì2014)

Successes and innovations: Under Ballmer, Microsoft entered the gaming industry with the launch of the Xbox in 2001, challenging Sony and Nintendo‚Äôs dominance. The company also released Windows XP, one of its most successful operating systems.

Challenges in the mobile market: Despite successes, Ballmer‚Äôs tenure faced setbacks, such as the underwhelming reception of Windows Vista and Microsoft‚Äôs failure to establish a strong foothold in the mobile market. The introduction of the iPhone in 2007 and the rise of Android further marginalized Microsoft‚Äôs smartphone efforts.

Strategic acquisitions: Ballmer spearheaded significant acquisitions, including Skype for $8.5 billion in 2011, bolstering Microsoft‚Äôs position in communication technologies.

Financial growth: Despite challenges, Microsoft‚Äôs annual revenue tripled during Ballmer‚Äôs tenure, reflecting its expanding product portfolio and global reach. He announced his retirement in 2013, stepping down in February 2014.

Satya Nadella: Reinventing Microsoft (2014‚ÄìPresent)

Shift to cloud computing: Nadella prioritized Microsoft Azure, turning it into a leader in cloud infrastructure. By 2020, Azure surpassed Microsoft‚Äôs Windows business, reflecting the success of this strategic pivot.

Subscription-based services: Nadella championed the shift to subscription models, with Microsoft 365 becoming a cornerstone of the company‚Äôs offerings. This transition provided consistent revenue streams and aligned with evolving user needs.
